original: Holmgren, Mats, civilingenjör, Norr-ivöpiing, f. 20/2/08 i Gbg av trafikch., major Sven H. o. Elsa Jonson. G. 33 m. Millie Claeson. — Stud:ex., KTH (E). Stud:- o. tj:res. t. Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Engl., HolL, Finl. o. Balticum. Anst. v. fälttelegr :kårens radiolab. 30-32, Radiofabr. Luxor i Motala 32-34, Elektr. Ind. A-B i Sthlm 34-37, Sv. A-B Philips 37-40, övering. v. Norrköp. Elektrotekn. Fabr. sed. 40. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören., Radiotekn. sällsk. o. Sv. kryssarkl. Skr.: pop. radiohandböcker, radiokurser f. brevsk., art. i facktidskr. Hobbies: amiatörsändniing o. segling.
translated: Holmgren, Mats, civil engineer, Norr-ivöpiing, b. 20/2/08 in Gothenburg to traffic chief, Major Sven H. and Elsa Jonson. Married in 1933 to Millie Claeson. - Completed secondary education and studied at the Royal Institute of Technology (E). Studied and worked in Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, Holland, Finland, and the Baltic states. Employed at the Field Telegraph Corps radiolab 1930-1932, the radio factory Luxor in Motala 1932-1934, Elektr. Ind. A-B in Stockholm 1934-1937, and at Swedish A-B Philips 1937-1940. Chief engineer at Norrköp. Elektrotekn. Fabr. since 1940. Member of the Swedish Technical Association, Radio Technology Society, and Swedish cruiser club. Wrote popular radio handbooks, radio courses for correspondence students, and articles for technical journals. Hobbies include amateur radio broadcasting and sailing.
